info.description: Congress.gov shares its application programming interface (API) with the public to ingest the Congressional data. Sign up for an API key from api.data.gov that you can use to access web services provided by Congress.gov. To learn more, view our GitHub repository.
info.title: Congress.gov API

text.example: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

title.example: A bill to repeal certain provisions relating to nutrition.

description.example: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability on September 20, 2023

title.example: H.R. 4984, D.C. Robert F. Kennedy Memorial Stadium Campus Revitalization Act

constitutionalAuthorityStatementText.example:
[Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 130 (Thursday, July 27, 2023)]
[House]
[Pages H4143-H4144]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. COMER:
H.R. 4984.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 17 of the U.S. Constitution,
in that the legislation ``to exercise exclusive Legislation
in all Cases
[[Page H4144]]
whatsoever, over such District (not exceeding ten Miles
square) as may, by Cession of particular States, and the
Acceptance of Congress, become the Seat of the Government of
the United States, and to exercise like Authority over all
Places purchased by the Consent of the Legislature of the
State in which the Same shall be, for the Erection of Forts,
Magazines, Arsenals, dock-Yards, and other needful
Buildings.''
The single subject of this legislation is:
To transfer administrative jurisdiction of the District of
Columbia RFK Memorial Stadium campus from the Secretary of
the Interior to the Administrator of General Services and
authorize a new lease with D.C. for redevelopment.

title.example: D.C. Robert F. Kennedy Memorial Stadium Campus Revitalization Act

description.example: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 912, the amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 117-32 is considered as adopted.

text.example: On agreeing to the Maloney, Carolyn B. amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.
On agreeing to the Maloney, Carolyn B. amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.

COVID-19 Medical Production Act

This bill provides additional funding for FY2021 to acquire medical supplies, vaccines, and other equipment to combat COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019) using authorities under the Defense Production Act of 1950. That act confers on the President a broad set of authorities to influence domestic industry to provide essential materials and goods for the national defense.

This funding is available through FY2025. Beginning in FY2023, it may be used to meet public health needs to address any pathogen determined by the President to have the potential to create a public health emergency.

title.example: A bill to amend the Health and Human Services Act of 1968 to provide for the establishment of a national health care system.

COVID-19 Medical Production Act

This bill provides additional funding for FY2021 to acquire medical supplies, vaccines, and other equipment to combat COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019) using authorities under the Defense Production Act of 1950. That act confers on the President a broad set of authorities to influence domestic industry to provide essential materials and goods for the national defense.

This funding is available through FY2025. Beginning in FY2023, it may be used to meet public health needs to address any pathogen determined by the President to have the potential to create a public health emergency.

title.example: SBA Assistance to Small Business Startups: Client Experiences and Program Impact
Providing for budget allocations, and for other purposes.

summary.example:
The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 directs Congress to adopt a budget resolution each spring, providing an agreement between the House and Senate on a budget plan for the upcoming fiscal year (and at least four additional years). The annual budget resolution includes certain spending and revenue levels that become enforceable through points of order once both chambers have adopted the resolution.
Congress does not always adopt a budget resolution, however, and this may complicate the development and consideration of budgetary legislation. Congress has, therefore, developed an alternative legislative tool, typically referred to as a “deeming resolution” because it is deemed to serve in place of an annual budget resolution for the purposes of establishing enforceable budgetary levels. 
On June 8, 2022, the House of Representatives adopted H.Res. 1151, a deeming resolution for FY2023. H.Res. 1151 provided a committee spending allocation (302(a) allocation) to the House Appropriations Committee ($1.603 trillion). It also directed the chair of the House Budget Committee to subsequently file a statement in the Congressional Record that includes committee spending allocations for all other committees, as well as aggregate spending and revenue levels. (Those levels were filed on June 21, 2022.) H.Res. 1151 specified that the levels filed in the Congressional Record be consistent with the “most recent baseline of the Congressional Budget Office,” meaning that the committee spending allocations (other than for the Appropriations Committee) and the aggregate spending and revenue levels have been set at the levels currently projected under current law. 
In addition to providing enforceable budgetary levels within the House, H.Res. 1151 grants authority to the chair of the House Budget Committee to “adjust” the budgetary levels provided under the deeming resolution in the future under specified circumstances. In addition, the resolution states that provisions designated as “emergency” shall be effectively exempt from House budgetary rules and specifies that certain accounts may receive advance appropriations for FY2024 and FY2025.

title.example: Settings Budgetary Levels: The House's FY2023 Deeming Resolution
PROTOCOL MODIFYING CONVENTION WITH BELGIUM FOR THE AVOIDANCE OF DOUBLE TAXATION

text.example: Resolution of advice and consent to ratification agreed to as amended in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 95 - 1. Record Vote Number: 282.

format.name: format
format.description: The data format. Value can be xml or json.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The starting record returned. 0 is the first record.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The number of records returned. The maximum limit is 250.

fromDateTime.name: fromDateTime
fromDateTime.description: The starting timestamp to filter by update date. Use format: YYYY-MM-DDT00:00:00Z.

toDateTime.name: toDateTime
toDateTime.description: The ending timestamp to filter by update date. Use format: YYYY-MM-DDT00:00:00Z.

sort.name: sort
sort.description: Sort by update date in Congress.gov. Value can be updateDate+asc or updateDate+desc.

congress.name: congress
congress.description: The congress number. For example, can be 117.

billType.name: billType
billType.description: The type of bill. Value can be hr, s, hjres, sjres, hconres, sconres, hres, or sres.

billNumber.name: billNumber
billNumber.description: The bill's assigned number. For example, the value can be 3076.

lawType.name: lawType
lawType.description: The law type. Values are either 'pub’ or ‘priv.’

amendmentType.name: amendmentType
amendmentType.description: The type of amendment. Value can be hamdt, samdt, or suamdt.

amendmentNumber.name: amendmentNumber
amendmentNumber.description: The amendment’s assigned number. For example, the value can be 2137.

currentMember.name: currentMember
currentMember.description: The status of the member. Use true or false

bioguideId.name: bioguideId
bioguideId.description: The bioguide identifier for the congressional member. For example, the value can be L000174.

stateCode.name: stateCode
stateCode.description: The two letter identifier for the state the member represents. For example, the value can be MI for Michigan.

district.name: district
district.description: The district number for the district the member represents. For example, the value can be 10.

session.name: session
session.description: The session number. The value can be 1 or 2.

voteNumber.name: voteNumber
voteNumber.description: The assigned roll call vote number. For example, 17.

housechamber.name: chamber
housechamber.description: The chamber name. Value can be house.

senatechamber.name: chamber
senatechamber.description: The chamber name. Value can be senate.

chamber.name: chamber
chamber.description: The chamber name. Value can be house, senate, or joint.

committeeCode.name: committeeCode
committeeCode.description: The committee code. For example, the value can be hspw00.

conference.name: conference
conference.description: Flag to indicate conference reports. Value can be true or false.

reportType.name: reportType
reportType.description: The type of committee report. Value can be hrpt, srpt, or erpt.

reportNumber.name: reportNumber
reportNumber.description: The committee report’s assigned number. For example, the value can be 617.

crsReportNumber.name: reportNumber
crsReportNumber.description: The number or ID of the report. For example, R47175.

jacketNumber.name: jacketNumber
jacketNumber.description: The jacket number for the print. For example, the value can be 48144.

eventId.name: eventId
eventId.description: The event identifier. For example, the value can be 115538.

y.name: y
y.description: The year the issue was published. For example, the value can be 2022.

m.name: m
m.description: The month the issue was published. For example, the value can be 6.

d.name: d
d.description: The day the issue was published. For example, the value can be 28.

volumeNumber.name: volumeNumber
volumeNumber.description: The specified volume of the daily Congressional record, for example 166.

issueNumber.name: issueNumber
issueNumber.description: The specified issue of the daily Congressional record, for example 153.

year.name: year
year.description: The specified year of the bound Congressional record, for example 1990.

month.name: month
month.description: The specified month of the bound Congressional record, for example 4 for April.

day.name: day
day.description: The specified day of the bound Congressional record, for example 18.

communicationType.name: communicationType
communicationType.description: The type of communication. Value can be ec, ml, pm, or pt.

senateCommunicationType.name: communicationType
senateCommunicationType.description: The type of communication. Value can be ec, pm, or pom.

communicationNumber.name: communicationNumber
communicationNumber.description: The communication’s assigned number. For example, the value can be 3324.

requirementNumber.name: requirementNumber
requirementNumber.description: The requirement’s assigned number. For example, the value can be 8070.

nominationNumber.name: nominationNumber
nominationNumber.description: The nomination’s assigned number. For example, the value can be 389.

ordinal.name: ordinal
ordinal.description: The ordinal number. For example, the value can be 1

treatyNumber.name: treatyNumber
treatyNumber.description: The treaty’s assigned number. For example, the value can be 13.

treatySuffix.name: treatySuffix
treatySuffix.description: The treaty’s partition letter value. For example, the value can be A.
